result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan William Asmus

defendant.name: Asmus, Ryan William
defendant.address: c/o Grace Place 505 West 8th Street, New Richmond, WI 54017

records.addlTxt:
3:00 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Michael Becker in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Scott Selmer appeared by video for Ryan William Asmus, Defendant Ryan William Asmus in court, in custody. INCLUDES 22CF269 (Set for PLEAS) and 22CF710. Atty. Selmer states that there was an agreement. ADA Becker states that the agreement needs to be revisited, requests additional STC. Court notes Motion to Modify Bond filed by State and prelim is needed on 22CF710. ADA Becker states that DE was unable to Grace Place. Atty. Selmer responds, notes Grace Place has 30-day limitation. ADA Becker requests bond modification regarding Grace Place condition. Court modifies bond. Atty. Selmer makes bond argument. ADA Becker responds. Court sets PH on 22CF710 and STC on 22CF269. Adjourned: 3:17 PM. kma
Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

1:17 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Stephanie Schmidt in court. Defendant Ryan William Asmus in court, in custody. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant doesn't qualify for PD- PFAC given. Bond argument. Court orders bond. Court sets STC. Adjourned 01:20 PM
Status conference scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on November 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
